*1/*2_intermediate.recommendation: Consider alternative P2Y12 inhibitor (prasugrel or ticagrelor) or alternative strategy per guideline context
*1/*2_intermediate.rationale: Intermediate metabolizers have reduced clopidogrel activation and can have higher ischemic event risk depending on clinical setting
*1/*2_intermediate.outcome_support: 4.3× higher event rate in PM/IM group

*2/*2_poor.recommendation: Use alternative P2Y12 inhibitor (prasugrel or ticagrelor)
*2/*2_poor.rationale: Poor metabolizers have reduced clopidogrel activation
*2/*2_poor.outcome_support: 4.3× higher event rate in PM/IM group

borderline_phenotype_risk.claim: Poor/Intermediate metabolizers have 4.28× higher ischemic event risk

intermediate_metabolizer_inclusion.claim: Borderline intermediate metabolizers (*1/*2) experience materially higher risk
intermediate_metabolizer_inclusion.evidence: Combined PM/IM group shows 4.28× risk elevation

system_alignment.claim: 100% system alignment with CYP2C19 diplotype recommendations
system_alignment.evidence: All 3 example diplotypes generate appropriate recommendations

clinical_implications.borderline_phenotypes: Intermediate metabolizers (*1/*2) should be considered for alternative antiplatelet therapy
clinical_implications.pre_treatment_genotyping: Supports routine CYP2C19 genotyping before clopidogrel initiation
clinical_implications.alternative_agents: Prasugrel or ticagrelor for reduced-function phenotypes

methodological_notes.endpoint_clarity: Symptomatic ischemic stroke/TIA as reported in Table 4
methodological_notes.subset_focus: Analysis restricted to clopidogrel-treated patients only
methodological_notes.reproducibility: All calculations traceable to raw table values
